main event: M/Sgt Ellis C. Stone, a member of the Army, observed an unidentified aerial phenomenon in the form of a sphere with luminous bluish-green and yellow color, moving in a gliding motion from right to left and descending gradually over San Antonio, Texas on January 20, 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed between the readings of 325째 to 297째 with an estimated time in sight of 5 seconds.
It appeared at an elevation of about 15째 and as it disappeared over a small hill, the elevation had dropped to about 12째.
The trail from the object varied in length and color from light pink with bright red sparks, emitting from the trail at about half the distance of its length.
Several individuals in the vicinity, including M/Sgt Stone's wife and sons, were identified as potential witnesses and were to be interrogated.
The persons at the CAA Office, Cowork Tower, and San Antonio Municipal Airport reported no unusual aerial activity during the evening.
sighted object: Unidentified aerial phenomenon in the form of a luminous bluish-green and yellow sphere
witnesses: M/Sgt Ellis C. Stone, his wife, sons, and potentially other individuals in the vicinity
photographs: No, the report does not mention any photographs
